text: Paul Jozef Crutzen (; 3 December 1933 â€“ 28 January 2021) was a Dutch atmospheric chemist. An Interview - Paul Crutzen talks to Harry Kroto Freeview video by the Vega Science Trust. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1995 with Mario J. Molina and F. Sherwood Rowland. He was known for work on the ozone layer and climate change. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988. Crutzen died on 28 January 2021 at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch chemists Category:Dutch Nobel Prize winners Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Amsterdam
title: Paul J. Crutzen
